title: Airworthiness Coordinator
content:
A career at Lilium is for those who want to do something extraordinary. We take pride in pushing the boundaries of engineering, technology and customer experience.  
As part of a team, you will tackle challenges and deliver something that has never been done before. By joining Lilium you will have the opportunity to work with a world-class entrepreneurial team of more than  800 people who are  as passionate about changing the world as you are.  
You will always act with safety and integrity in mind and embody our core behaviors of efficient and positive collaboration, ownership of time, continuous improvements and, ultimately delivering results.
We thrive on diversity and creating an inclusive culture, with more than 50 nationalities currently working hard to bring our vision of a sustainable world to life. JD – Airworthiness Coordinator 
A career at Lilium is for those who want to do something extraordinary. We take pride in pushing the boundaries of engineering, technology and customer experience.As part of a team, you will tackle challenges and deliver something that has never been done before. By joining Lilium you will have the opportunity to work with a world-class entrepreneurial team who are  as passionate about changing the world as you are.You will always act with safety and integrity in mind and embody our core behaviors of efficient and positive collaboration, ownership of time, continuous improvements and, ultimately delivering results.We thrive on diversity and creating an inclusive culture, with more than 50 nationalities currently working hard to bring our vision of a sustainable world to life.The RoleAs part of the Office of Airworthiness, the Airworthiness Coordinator will perform certification tasks to secure EASA and other Competent Authority airworthiness approvals for Lilium products. He/she will be responsible for supporting the certification program activities , maintaining the certification requirements in the requirements management tool, preparing the minutes of meetings, tracking the action items , and coordinating the certification topics internally with the OoA Team members and IPTs. Lilium welcomes people from all over the world. We are a multinational company and happy to support our new top talents with relocation. We have helped our new hires to meet their Visa criteria and successfully settle in Munich.Your Day To DayYou will report into the Deputy Head of Airworthiness and work closely with all our Engineering and Certification Teams give support to the CVEs , IPTs and Designated Airworthiness Engineers. Your contribution will be key for the development of Lilium’s ground-breaking aircraft.

Assist in generation and review of certification packages and manage their delivery to regulatory authorities to achieve product and type design certification.
Interface with EASA in various areas such as aircraft certification, development of means of compliance, regulatory changes, flight standards, inspections and continued airworthiness.
Co-ordinate project certification activities as required internally with Lilium teams and externally with the authorities.
Prepare the Minutes of Meetings, coordinate the actions with the IPTs.
Generate and track the status of the EASA / FAA action items on Jira.
Coordinate and prepare the meeting materials with the IPTs (Integrated Product Teams) and CE ( Chief Engineering).
Maintain the certification requirements and keep the requirements management tool up to date for Type Certification Requirement.  
Assist in generation of performance and progress reports of certification tasks.
Support the development and maintenance of the Design Organisation Handbook procedures.
Maintain DOA records, engineering files and company records.
Representing the company in meetings with authorities as well as taking part in international working groups and committees such as Eurocae, ASTM, GAMA.


Your Profile

Strong motivation to contribute to the product certification and airworthiness process.
1-5 Years experience in aviation field preferably with EASA Part-21 or similar regulations.
Any knowledge of Aircraft Certification and Development Assurance is beneficial.
Engineering bachelor’s degree (BEng/BSc) desirable.
Positive contributor to company objectives.
Previous experience in the creation of certification procedures in line with regulatory requirements or Engineering Quality standards.
Knowledge of EASA and FAA airworthiness and environmental requirements
Prepared to work hours to suit certification projects and activities as required.
Ability to support occasional national and international travel at short notice.
Confident in delivering technical information in presentations
Previous experience of working with rulemaking associations including EuroCAE, ASTM, GAMA, SAE.
Literate in Office software and documentation control systems
Familiar with requirements management tools (siemens doors, polarion, etc. ) and project management tools (jira, deltek, etc.).
